rename.from: Module id not stable when compiling on different CI environments
rename.to: Module id not stable when compiling on different CI instances

body: Please provide reproducible test repo or steps to reproduce
@alexander-akait Hi. I am having trouble creating a repo. When will a module id contains layer information? I mean the hash attached after the `module.request`?

@alexander-akait I suspect the problem is from this line https://github.com/webpack/webpack/blob/1f0bdf722098975919e5758475c32a02bfe14d06/lib/NormalModule.js#L307 where the `this.layer` was changing in my different CI environments. However when I try to repo with a simpler setup I had trouble making an example that would produce a module id with layer hash. Like the code was always executing the condition branch of `this.layer === null`. Do you know when the `this.layer` will not be null?

@alexander-akait Thanks for help I can reproduce the issue now. Here is the repo: https://github.com/randing89/github-brwfkb. I used `patch-package` to add a console log in `DeterministicModuleIdsPlugin.js`. After cloning the repo, execute `npm install && npm run build` in folder `a` and `b`. You can see webpack is assigning different module ids in the 2 runs. However the code is exactly the same in those folders.

![image](https://user-images.githubusercontent.com/640557/129932797-c3eed8ff-1317-4d8c-93ca-48ff598669c4.png)
@alexander-akait Thanks! I also updated the ticket with the result of webpack 5.33.2

rename.from: Module id not stable when compiling on different CI instances
rename.to: Module id not stable when compiling the same code in different folders

issue.title: make some things context-independent

repository.name: webpack
repository.description: A bundler for javascript and friends. Packs many modules into a few bundled assets. Code Splitting allows for loading parts of the application on demand. Through "loaders", modules can be CommonJs, AMD, ES6 modules, CSS, Images, JSON, Coffeescript, LESS, ... and your custom stuff.

issue.body:
* ConcatenatedModule.identifier()
* NormalModule source urls

fixes #14014
